column1: Las Estrellas ("The Stars"; previously El Canal de las Estrellas
column2: or "The Channel of the Stars") is one of the cornerstone networks of Televisa
column3: with affiliate stations all over Mexico
column4: flagshipped at XEW-TDT in Mexico City. Many of the programs of Las Estrellas are seen in the United States on Univision

column1: Las Estrellas is available as a pay television network in Europe and Australia as Las Estrellas Europa and Las Estrellas Latinoamérica in Central and South America through Televisa Networks. Both feeds differ from the Las Estrellas programming
column2: usually broadcasting shows weeks behind their original broadcast.
XEW-TDT and the Las Estrellas schedule is available in full on Rogers Cable (limited to the Greater Toronto Area) and Bell Fibe TV as an eligible foreign service.

column1: Weekday programming in the afternoon and prime time consists of telenovelas. Las Estrellas airs sports programming and sports specials like the Olympic Games and the FIFA World Cup. Morning and afternoon programming consists of news
column4: and variety shows. Night time programming is filled with a news program and Univision-produced shows. Examples of shows produced by Las Estrellas are Recuerda y Gana
column7: and Cuéntamelo ya. The network also produces and airs the Premios TVyNovelas
column8: sponsored by the Televisa-owned magazine of the same name and considered the highest honor in the domestic Mexican television industry.
